snippet: Zach Parise and Ryan Suter, the two most sought-after free agents on the N.H.L. market, signed deals for 13 years and $98 million.
abstract: Minnesota Wild pull off a coup by signing Zach Parise and Ryan Suter, the two most sought-after free agents on the NHL market, awarding each with a 13-year, $98 million contract; Parise reluctantly leaves the New Jersey Devils, with whom he had spent his entire NHL career; Suter established himself as one of the best defensemen in hockey with the Nashville Predators.
lead_paragraph: Zach Parise and Ryan Suter, the two most sought-after free agents on the N.H.L. market, signed deals for 13 years and $98 million.

headline.seo: In N.H.L. Free Agency, Wild Sign Parise and Suter
headline.main: Parise and Suter Both Sign With Wild
headline.print_headline: Wild Pull Off Coup by Luring Parise from Devils and Suter From Predators
